utilityFiles

Matrix.h File Reference

A set of methods that perform matrix operations (matrices are represented by vectors) They are expected to be laid out like so:
0 1 2
3 4 5
7 8 9
. More...

#include <vector>
#include <math.h>
#include <sstream>

Detailed Description

A set of methods that perform matrix operations (matrices are represented by vectors) They are expected to be laid out like so:
0 1 2
3 4 5
7 8 9
.

Function Documentation

T  array[],
unsigned int  size
) 
 

Copies an array into a vector.

Parameters:
vec the vector result
array the array of values to be copied
size the size of the array. The caller is responsible for getting this right!

Multiplies a 3 dimensional vector by a matrix.

Parameters:

Returns:
the result of the multiplication (a 3 dimensional vector) Thanks to Gopi M. for giving me the confidence to get through this function

template<class T>
vector<T> vector3Rotate (  vector< T >  vec,
vector< T >  rotateAxis,
double  degree,
bool  printDebug = true,
bool  doNotify = false
) 
 

vector3Rotate rotates about an almost-arbitrary axis: the axis is assumed to have one of its endpoints at at the origin (simplifies/speeds the calcuation and serves our purposes)

Parameters:
vec the vector to rotate
rotateAxis the axis to rotate the vector about
degree the amount to rotate the vector (in degrees)
Returns:
the rotated vector Thanks to Gopi M for giving me the confidence to get through this function Also thanks to http://www.mines.edu/~gmurray/ArbitraryAxisRotation/ArbitraryAxisRotation.html

template<class T>
vector<T> vector3RotateY (  vector< T >  vec,
double  degree,
bool  printDebug = true
) 
 

Rotates the given vector around the Y axis.

Parameters:
vec the vector to rotate (must be a 3 dimensinal vector)
degree How many degrees to rotate the vector (in degrees)
